prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Thomas Ball Fauntleroy Papers, Accession #12711-a, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was made a gift to the University on August 12, 1966 by Mrs. Thomas Fauntleroy Ball.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: University of South Carolina, B.S., electrical engineering, University of Virginia, M.S.,1919; University of Virginia Instructor, Adjunct Professor and Assistant Professor of Physics, 1916-1922; also, taught at the University of South Carolina and headed the physics dept., United States Naval Academy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection, 1825-1961, contains ca. 265 items, including correspondence, printed material, and various awards of Thomas Fauntleroy Ball, a University of Virginia graduate and professor of physics. These papers record his Navy service, his tenure as an employee at Hughes Aircraft Company, and some early genealogical records.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged in alphabetical order; oversized materials are arranged chronologically.
